Work Examples

Some examples from the Univeristy of Kentucky College of Medicine
Blog

Drupal 8 hosted on Pantheon
HTML / CSS / Drupal 8 Views

Univeristy of Kentucky College of Medicine Blog

A Drupal 8 site hosted on Pantheon, intended to highlight research activity and accomplishments within the College of Medicine. Initially intended as a dedicated blog for the college, the site was quickly transformed into a communication portal during the Covid-19 pandemic. Highlighted in the image above is the functionality of the blog card shown on the landing page that is created from a view and custom CSS.

Pipeline Program

Drupal 7
HTML / CSS / jQuery / AJAX

Univeristy of Kentucky College of Medicine Pipeline

A feature on a College of Medicine Medical Education sub-domain that served as a companion piece to a brochure to help prospective students quickly navigate the summer medical camp application process. The challenge was to provide all information to prospective students while maintaining a relatively short page. Highlighted above is my solution built in Drupal 7 with a block plugin(PHP), custom CSS, and JavaScript to call the AJAX.

Strategic Plan

Drupal 7
HTML / CSS / PHP

Univeristy of Kentucky College of Medicine Strategic Plan

A feature added to the College of Medicine domain to present the progress within the COMMITS initiative. Highlighted above is a dashboard built in Drupal 7 with custom CSS and data updated through the PHP filter on the node.

Leadership Directory

Drupal 7
HTML / CSS / Views

Univeristy of Kentucky College of Medicine Leadership Directory

My first assignment at the College of Medicine to revamp the college leadership directory look and mobile functionality. Highlighted above is the directory with responsive CSS, a new View, and updates to user profile attributes, that automatically populate based on the user's specified role and seniority.

Personal Projects

An Oklahoma themed Simon clone create with Vue.js. Features include dificulty progression, current sequence indicator and longest sequence indicator.

Code Demo

A personal tracker that allows users to track anything they would like and quickly look for relationships between the things they track. Built with a Laravel framework, using Bootstrap for form validation and PostgreSQL database.

Code Demo

A Connect Four clone created during one of our classroom code-alongs to show us how to build a Laravel application.

Code Demo

A Little Bit About Me

Three years ago, I transitioned from a career in manufacturing to pursue a career in web development. While at the University of Kentucky HealthCare, I have been able to develop my programming skills in both higher education and healthcare environments. New to Lincoln, I have enjoyed the welcoming and friendly atmosphere. I look forward to discovering new challenges in the technology industry while utilizing my experience in team building, project management, web development, and customer service.
